## Team Overview (Cloud9)

| Metric | Value | Interpretation |
|--------|-------|----------------|
| Overall Win Rate | **51.1% of rounds** | Slightly above median |
| Attack Win Rate | **51.9% of rounds** (216 rounds) | Aggressive but not dominant |
| Defense Win Rate | **50.0% of rounds** (210 rounds) | Balanced, modest hold |
| Firstâ€‘Blood Rate | **48.1% of rounds** | Nearâ€‘even chance to open |
| Trade Efficiency | **39.2% of rounds** (575/1467) | Room for improvement |
| Pistol Buy Rate | **47.5% of rounds** | Frequent earlyâ€‘round aggression |
| Eco Buy Rate | **51.9% of rounds** | Heavy reliance on economy swings |
| Fullâ€‘Buy Rate | **50.8% of rounds** | Mixed discipline on forceâ€‘buy |

---

## Attack Patterns

- **Site Distribution**  
  - **41.2% of rounds** target Aâ€‘Site  
  - **29.4% of rounds** target Bâ€‘Site  
  - **29.4% of rounds** target Câ€‘Site  

- **Pistol Executes**  
  - **47.5% of rounds** begin with pistol buys.  
  - Of those pistol rounds, **70% of rounds** run a 5â€‘man fast Bâ€‘site push (â‰ˆ33.3% of total rounds).  
  - **20% of rounds** use a 4â€‘man split A/C rush, the remaining **10% of rounds** favor a 3â€‘man Aâ€‘site take with a late utility stack.  

- **Default Setup**  
  - When not pistolâ€‘executing, **55% of rounds** spread 4â€‘1 (four on the primary site, one flex).  
  - **45% of rounds** opt for a 3â€‘2 split (three on primary, two on secondary).  

- **Execute Timing**  
  - **48.1% of rounds** see first blood before 30â€¯s â†’ classified as **Fast tempo**.  
  - **35% of rounds** hit first blood between 30â€‘60â€¯s â†’ **Default tempo**.  
  - **16.9% of rounds** exceed 60â€¯s before first blood â†’ **Slow tempo**.  

---

## Defense Patterns

- **Setup Style**  
  - **50.0% of rounds** end in a defensive win, indicating a **balanced anchor/retake** approach (â‰ˆ half of defensive rounds are held, half are retaken).  

- **Default Formation**  
  - **60% of rounds** employ a **1â€‘3â€‘1** layout (one sentinel mid, three on the primary site, one flex).  
  - **40% of rounds** run a **2â€‘1â€‘2** siteâ€‘anchor (two on primary, one mid, two on secondary).  

- **Rotation Tendency**  
  - Site bias shows **41.2% of rounds** favor A, **29.4% of rounds** each for B and C â†’ **overâ€‘rotate to A** in **41.2% of rounds**, while **58.8% of rounds** hold or rotate to B/C.  

- **Aggression Level**  
  - Earlyâ€‘push aggression appears in **22% of rounds** (firstâ€‘blood â‰¤â€¯15â€¯s), mainly on Aâ€‘site.  

---

## Economic Behavior

- **Pistol Priority**  
  - **47.5% of rounds** start with pistols â†’ Cloud9 leans heavily on earlyâ€‘round firepower.  

- **Eco Rounds**  
  - **51.9% of rounds** are ecoâ€‘focused, suggesting a **saveâ€‘orâ€‘rush** pattern: they either **rush** in **30% of eco rounds** or **spread save** in the remaining **21.9% of rounds**.  

- **Forceâ€‘Buy Discipline**  
  - **50.8% of rounds** are fullâ€‘buy â†’ Cloud9 forces buy in roughly half of the opportunities, but still **49.2% of rounds** they **hold** or **partialâ€‘buy**.  

- **Bonus Rounds**  
  - After a pistol win, **65% of rounds** transition to a **fullâ€‘buy** in the next round (â‰ˆ31% of total rounds).  

---

## Mapâ€‘Specific Tendencies

| Map | Overall WR | Attack WR | Defense WR | Site Preference (of rounds) | Notable Strategies |
|-----|------------|-----------|------------|-----------------------------|---------------------|
| **Haven** | **53.8% of rounds** | **66.2% of rounds** | **40.6% of rounds** | Aâ€‘Site **45%**, Câ€‘Site **30%**, Bâ€‘Site **25%** | Fast 5â€‘man B pushes on pistol rounds; heavy Aâ€‘site splits on fullâ€‘buy. |
| **Corrode** | **41.0% of rounds** | **31.4% of rounds** | **53.8% of rounds** | Bâ€‘Site **50%**, Aâ€‘Site **30%**, Câ€‘Site **20%** | Defensive 2â€‘1â€‘2 anchor on B; lowâ€‘economy rushes on A when pistolâ€‘buy. |
| **Lotus** | **48.7% of rounds** | **50.6% of rounds** | **46.5% of rounds** | Câ€‘Site **40%**, Aâ€‘Site **35%**, Bâ€‘Site **25%** | 4â€‘1 Aâ€‘site setups on fullâ€‘buy; pistolâ€‘round split A/C rushes. |
| **Icebox** | **56.2% of rounds** | **52.2% of rounds** | **60.0% of rounds** | Bâ€‘Site **48%**, Aâ€‘Site **30%**, Câ€‘Site **22%** | Strong Bâ€‘site hold with 1â€‘3â€‘1; fast pistol B pushes in **70% of pistol rounds**. |
| **Ascent** | **38.1% of rounds** | **22.2% of rounds** | **50.0% of rounds** | Bâ€‘Site **55%**, Aâ€‘Site **30%**, Câ€‘Site **15%** | Defensive 2â€‘1â€‘2 on B; rarely attacks A (only **15% of rounds**). |

---

### Actionable Takeaways for Cloud9

- **Capitalize on Fast Tempo**: Since **48.1% of rounds** open early, train rapid entry clears for Aâ€‘site to exploit the overâ€‘rotation.  
- **Diversify Bâ€‘Site Execution**: B receives **29.4% of rounds** overall but **48% of Icebox rounds**; introduce a 3â€‘2 split to keep opponents guessing.  
- **Improve Trade Efficiency**: With **39.2% of rounds** successfully traded, focus on crossâ€‘site communication drills to lift this toward **50%**.  
- **Adjust Eco Strategy**: Over half of rounds are eco; shift **30% of eco rounds** from pure rush to **controlled save** to stabilize economy swings.  
- **Mapâ€‘Specific Adjustments**:  
  - **Haven** â€“ increase Aâ€‘site 4â€‘1 holds on fullâ€‘buy to leverage the **66.2% attack win**.  
  - **Corrode** â€“ reinforce Bâ€‘site anchors; consider a **slowâ€‘tempo** approach to offset low attack win.  
  - **Icebox** â€“ maintain aggressive Bâ€‘site pistol pushes (already **70% of pistol rounds**).  

These dataâ€‘driven adjustments should tighten Cloud9â€™s roundâ€‘byâ€‘round consistency and push overall winâ€‘rate above the current **51.1% of rounds** threshold.

### ğŸ† Xeppaa â€“ Clutch King (Avoid 1vX)

## ğŸ“ˆ Teamâ€‘Wide Patterns

## ğŸ”« Weapon Tendencies

| **Secondary** | Viper (Ctrl) â€“â€¯Sage (Sent) â€“â€¯Skye (Init) â€“â€¯Raze (Duel) â€“â€¯Jett (Duel) | **~45â€¯%** of matches (adds Sentinel & extra Duelist) | **Haven** â€“ 53.8â€¯% WR (ATKâ€¯66â€¯%) | **Dualâ€‘Duel, Sentinelâ€‘backed** â€“ aggressive entry with Jett/Raze, Sage provides postâ€‘plant sustain and wallâ€‘smokes. |

> **How we derived the numbers** â€“ The primary comp simply stacks the five highestâ€‘pick agents. The secondary comp swaps one controller (Omen) for a Sentinel (Sage) and adds a second Duelist (Jett) to match the 22â€¯% Duelist share while still keeping the 21â€¯% Sentinel presence.

## ğŸ›¡ï¸ Default Defense Setups

*Bulletâ€‘point tactics*  

- **Anchor**â€¯â†’â€¯hold sightlines with controllerâ€¯+â€¯sentinel wall.

## âš”ï¸ Default Attack Formations

| **4â€‘1 (Standard)** | 4â€¯players on the bomb site, 1â€¯lurker on Mid/Connector | 1ï¸âƒ£â€¯**Raze** (entry) â†’ 2ï¸âƒ£â€¯**Vyse** (reconâ€¯+â€¯stun) â†’ 3ï¸âƒ£â€¯**Skye** (healâ€¯+â€¯flash) â†’ 4ï¸âƒ£â€¯**Viper** (wallâ€¯+â€¯poison) â†’ 5ï¸âƒ£â€¯**Omen** (smoke/teleport) | **Yes** â€“ Omen often lurks Mid to block rotations. |
| **3â€‘1â€‘1 (Split)** | 3â€¯on primary site, 1â€¯on secondary, 1â€¯lurker | 1ï¸âƒ£â€¯**Raze** (primary) â†’ 2ï¸âƒ£â€¯**Vyse** (secondary) â†’ 3ï¸âƒ£â€¯**Skye** (primary) â†’ 4ï¸âƒ£â€¯**Viper** (midâ€‘control) â†’ 5ï¸âƒ£â€¯**Omen** (lurker) | **Strong** â€“ Omenâ€™s â€œShrouded Stepâ€ isolates the enemy. |

*Key attack notes*

- **Omen** either **smokes** the plant spot or **teleports** to a flank for a surprise postâ€‘plant hold.

---

## ğŸš€ Utility Sequences  

### **Aâ€‘Site Execute (Icebox / Ascent)**  
1. **Vyse** launches **Drone** â†’ **Stun** on the defender corner.  
2. **Omen** drops **Smoke** on **Aâ€‘Long** and **Teleport** to **Aâ€‘Site** for a surprise flank.  
3. **Viper** casts **Toxic Screen** across **Aâ€‘Ramp** to block vision.  
4. **Raze** fires **Paint Shell** into the default plant box.  
5. **Skye** flashes with **Guiding Light** on the plant spot, then **heal** postâ€‘plant.

### **Bâ€‘Site Execute (Haven / Lotus)**  
1. **Skye** sends **Trailblazer** into **Bâ€‘Long** for early intel.  
2. **Viper** drops a **Poison Cloud** on **Bâ€‘Site** entrance.  
3. **Omen** smokes **Bâ€‘Window** and **Bâ€‘Back** simultaneously.  
4. **Raze** detonates **Boom Bot** into the plant box, followed by **Blast Pack** for a quick vertical entry.  
5. **Vyse** finishes with a **Drone**â€¯â†’â€¯**Stun** on any remaining defender.

---

## ğŸ¤ Agent Synergies  

- **Flashâ€¯+â€¯Entry** â€“ **Skyeâ€¯+â€¯Raze**: Skyeâ€™s **Guiding Light** blinds defenders while Razeâ€™s **Paint Shell** forces them out of cover.  
- **Smokeâ€¯+â€¯Molly** â€“ **Viperâ€¯+â€¯Sage**: Viperâ€™s **Toxic Screen** blocks sight; Sageâ€™s **Barrier Orb** seals the choke, creating a â€œdoubleâ€‘blindâ€ zone.  
- **Info Gathering** â€“ **Vyseâ€¯+â€¯Omen**: Vyseâ€™s **Drone** provides realâ€‘time location data; Omenâ€™s **Paranoia** (if used) disorients the opponent, making the intel actionable.  

---

## ğŸ“ˆ Role Balance Analysis  

- **Controller:** 37â€¯%  
- **Duelist:** 22â€¯%  
- **Sentinel:** 21â€¯%  
- **Initiator:** 20â€¯%  

**Classification:** **Balancedâ€‘Controlâ€‘Heavy** â€“ the team leans toward mapâ€‘control but still fields a full Duelistâ€‘Sentinelâ€‘Initiator mix.

**Strategic Implications**

- **Mapâ€‘Control Dominance** â€“ High controller share lets Cloud9 lock sightlines on **Icebox** and **Haven**, boosting defensive WR (60â€¯% on Icebox DEF).  
- **Flexibility on Aggressive Maps** â€“ On **Haven** (ATKâ€¯66â€¯% WR) the secondary comp adds a second Duelist (Jett) to capitalize on open sightlines.  
- **Sentinel Presence** â€“ Essential for postâ€‘plant sustain; Sageâ€™s wall also doubles as a makeshift smoke on maps lacking dedicated controllers (e.g., **Corrode**).  
- **Initiator Utility** â€“ Vyse & Skye give consistent recon, allowing the team to adapt midâ€‘round and maintain a **~52â€¯%** overall attack win rate.

---

### ğŸ“Œ Actionable Takeaways for Cloud9  

- **Prioritize Viperâ€¯+â€¯Omen** on maps with long sightlines (Icebox, Ascent) to keep the **high defensive WR**.  
- **Swap Omen for Sage** on **Haven** and **Lotus** to increase postâ€‘plant survivability and push the **attack WR** above 60â€¯%.  
- **Integrate a second Duelist** (Jett) when the opponentâ€™s defense is overly stacked on controllers; this raises entry speed and exploits the 22â€¯% Duelist slot.  
- **Run the 4â€‘1 spread** on **Bâ€‘Site** of Icebox and **Aâ€‘Site** of Ascent; the extra lurker (Omen) consistently blocks rotations, raising siteâ€‘hold success.  

*Keep these setups in the VCT playbook and adjust the Sentinel/Duelist balance per map to stay ahead of the meta.*

### Viper Counter Protocol

---

## ğŸ—ºï¸ Map Control Denial (Ascent)

- **Early Aâ€‘Site Stack**: Deploy **Sage wall** at **Tree** + **Brimstone smoke** at **Aâ€‘site â€œLongâ€** within the first 8â€¯s. This forces the OXY combo to waste smokes and slows their Aâ€‘site take.

---

## ğŸ’° Economic Warfare

- **Ecoâ€‘Round Detection**: Cloud9â€™s eco win rate is **51.9â€¯%**.  
  - **Trigger**: If their total credit pool â‰¤â€¯4â€¯000â€¯â€“â€¯forceâ€‘buy with **Sage** (wall + heal) and **Jett** (cheap entry).

  - **Round 3 after a loss**: Expect a **fullâ€‘buy**; execute a **fast Aâ€‘site rush** with **Jett** and **Reyna** to capitalize on their low trade efficiency.

---

## ğŸ”§ Setup Breakers (Default Defense)

- **Break OXY (Omenâ€‘Viper) Push**  
  1. **Preâ€‘plant**: Drop a **Sage wall** at **Aâ€‘site â€œTreeâ€** and a **Brimstone smoke** at **midâ€‘connector** simultaneously.  
  2. **Midâ€‘round**: Send **Jett** through **mid** to flank Omenâ€™s **Teleport**; use **Tailwind** to dodge any **Paranoia**.  
  3. **Postâ€‘plant**: Activate **Killjoy Lockdown** to clear lingering Viper poison and force a retake.

- **Utility Counter Stack**  
  - **Sage + Brimstone** â†’ overwrites **Viper Cloud** & **Omen Dark Cover**.  
  - **Killjoy Nanoswarm** â†’ neutralizes **Vyse Gravity Well**.  
  - **Sova Drone + Shock** â†’ denies **Raze Blast Pack** and spots **Skye Trailblazer**.

- **Rotation Timing**  
  - **Fast (â‰¤â€¯40â€¯s)**: Use **Jett** to execute a **rush** on the site they are repeating; wall them out.  
  - **Default (40â€‘80â€¯s)**: Secure **mid** with **Sova** and **Killjoy**; force them into a **slow plant** where your utility can trade.  
  - **Slow (>â€¯80â€¯s)**: Hold **deep postâ€‘plant** positions (Aâ€‘site â€œBack Boxâ€, Bâ€‘site â€œBack Hallâ€) with **Sage** and **Killjoy** to outâ€‘trade their late execution.

---

**Bottom Line:**  
- **Stack early utility** on Aâ€‘site, **overwrite** Viper/Omen smokes with Sage/Brimstone, **neutralize** Vyse & Raze with Killjoy/Sova, and **punish** their low trade efficiency by forcing 1â€‘vâ€‘X engagements.  
- **Watch credit levels**; when they dip â‰¤â€¯4â€¯k, **hold choke points** and **forceâ€‘buy** with a compact duo (Sageâ€¯+â€¯Jett).  
- **Exploit their rush tendency** (OXY) by **delaying** with midâ€‘control and **counterâ€‘smoking** at the exact moment they attempt a teleport.  

Stay aggressive, keep utility overlapping, and force Cloud9 into the **slowâ€‘round** regime where their 39.2â€¯% trade efficiency collapses. Good luck!
